page.title: 11Religion; Upton Snodsbury.
page.content: Each of the four villages is centred round a church of ancient foundation . St Kenelm's, Upton Snodsbury has a fine square 15th century tower with a full peal of 6 bells, and an older nave and chancel. Kenelm was a local 8th century saint who is buried at nearby Winchcombe Abbey and there are 5 churchs dedicated to him - reputedly each founded where his body rested on the way to Winchcombe from the Welsh border. St.Leonard's, Broughton Hackett, is a tiny church dating from the 13th and 14th centuries with a small half timbered tower. These two parishes share a vicar with 3 other parishes outside this area, as the present trend is for adjaceent small villages communities to be grouped together under 1 incumbent. The present vicar lives at Grafton Flyford.
